name: Mixed Bag 30 Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [B] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which is not a quilt design?
questions.explanation:
Stone Wall.

	Quilting is the process of stitching together two (or more) layers of fabric, filled with a soft substance (usually cotton).

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT synthetic or semi-synthetic?
questions.explanation:
Burlap.

	Burlap is a coarse fabric made of jute, flax, hemp or cotton.

questions.text: Which is not a subspecies of the oak tree?
questions.explanation:
Pine.

	The oak contains about 450 species but only about 60 are found in the United States and Canada.

questions.text: What tribe did Custer encounter at 'Little Big Horn'?
questions.explanation:
Sioux.

	It was a force of mainly Sioux but also had some northern Cheyenne warriors in the group.

questions.text: What do the British call a flashlight?
questions.explanation:
Torch.

	A lot of things are known by different words in England.

questions.text: True or false: The Americans used to make a twenty dollar gold coin?
questions.explanation:
True.

	The last regular issue gold coins were struck in 1933. Special commemorative coins have been issued since then.

questions.text: The Anaconda Mine is known for producing what metal?
questions.explanation:
Copper.

	Anaconda is a city in Montana originally called Copperopolis until 1888.

questions.text: Which of these countries is a world leader in the production of lumber?
questions.explanation:
Russia.

	Russia, the United States, Canada, Japan, Sweden, Germany, Poland, France, Finland and Brazil are all major lumber producing countries.

questions.text: What state did former majority leader Mike Mansfield come from?
questions.explanation:
Montana.

	He held the post for 16 years. Upon retiring from the senate he became the United States Ambassador to Japan.

questions.text: Which world leader died six weeks after Eisenhower took his oath?
questions.explanation:
Stalin.

	He was the General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR from 1922-1953. He died of complications from a stroke.
